title: What is SC OsF?
content:
Hi I am looking for some information and I think this the best forum I can find answers on.

Can some one please define and explain SC OsF please.

Thanks a ton.
author: typeluv

comments.content:
SC = small caps  
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small\_caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021045935/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_caps "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small\_caps")

OsF = Old style figures  
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old\_style\_figures](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021045935/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_style_figures "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old\_style\_figures")

Can anyone help with which typefaces (both serif and sans serif) these are?

Thanks.

[http://www.behance.net/Gallery/Francis-Coffee/264669](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021045935/http:/www.behance.net/Gallery/Francis-Coffee/264669 "http://www.behance.net/Gallery/Francis-Coffee/264669")

"Francis" is pretty close to Stempel Garamond, the one I have is narrower, so it could be squooshed or more likely some other Garamond.

You'd get more response if you started a new thread in the ID section.
Is is close to Stempel Garamond with "francis" written in smallcaps.
